title: 112_hr3048
content: The Act titled "Tax Relief for Victims of Disasters Act of 2011" includes a special rule for determining earned income applicable to federally declared disasters. The "Tax Relief for Victims of Disasters Act of 2011" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code regarding qualified federally declared disaster individuals. This defines individuals affected by federally declared disasters between 2010 and 2013. The "Tax Relief for Victims of Disasters Act of 2011" amends the Internal Revenue Code to define qualified federally declared disaster individuals affected between 2010 and 2013. It includes provisions regarding individuals displaced from their principal place of abode or employed in the disaster area on the applicable date. The amendments made by the "Tax Relief for Victims of Disasters Act of 2011" include defining qualified federally declared disaster individuals and specifying the effective date for disasters occurring after December 31, 2010. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include losses attributable to federally declared disasters occurring after December 31, 2010, and before January 1, 2013. The amendments apply to disasters occurring after December 31, 2010. SEC. 4. Additional exemption for housing qualified federally declared disaster displaced individuals. For taxable years in 2011 or 2012, a natural person's taxable income is reduced by $500 for each qualified federally declared disaster displaced individual. The reduction is limited to $2,000 and individuals can only be counted once. Taxpayer identification number is required for individuals to be considered. For a taxpayer to claim a deduction for housing provided to a qualified federally declared disaster displaced individual, the individual must be provided housing free of charge for 60 consecutive days in the taxpayer's principal residence. No deduction is allowed if the taxpayer receives any rent or other compensation for the housing.
